messages: 2c39bccd623947fa6224ea57d2a727de (17:45): whoa, that took long
2c39bccd623947fa6224ea57d2a727de (17:45): http://lists.w3.org/Archives/Public/public-pfwg-comments/2010JulSep/0023.html
91a1154ddaa50f602cc383ee236c3517 (18:04): how close are we to a stable-ish websocket spec?
91a1154ddaa50f602cc383ee236c3517 (18:04): trying to decide if should update to the latest spec now or just wait a bit.
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (18:04): Good question.
91a1154ddaa50f602cc383ee236c3517 (18:04): it's likely the browsers haven't caught up anyway
2c39bccd623947fa6224ea57d2a727de (18:06): 91a1154ddaa50f602cc383ee236c3517, about as close as yesterday or a couple of weeks ago
91a1154ddaa50f602cc383ee236c3517 (18:07): yeah.  that's what i'm afraid of.  ;)
91a1154ddaa50f602cc383ee236c3517 (18:07): i think the only real change i'm missing is the frame formatting
91a1154ddaa50f602cc383ee236c3517 (18:08): which, i have to say, i'm excited about.  makes frame parsing much simpler.
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (18:08): 91a1154ddaa50f602cc383ee236c3517: The editor changed and the new one wants something much more complex
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (18:08): Unless that is what you mean
91a1154ddaa50f602cc383ee236c3517 (18:09): i mean the change that made all frame length delimited.
91a1154ddaa50f602cc383ee236c3517 (18:09): is Hixie no longer the editor?
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (18:09): He is editing the API
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (18:09): Ian Fette is editing the protocol
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (18:09): He wants something way more complex
91a1154ddaa50f602cc383ee236c3517 (18:09): any url on that?  or a mailing list?
91a1154ddaa50f602cc383ee236c3517 (18:10): looks like maybe thehybi list
6b57ea7f33069df5914663ba9e59afdf (18:10): was it actually announced somewhere that I.Fette is the new editor
6b57ea7f33069df5914663ba9e59afdf (18:10): needs to read all the hybi emails
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (18:11): 6b57ea7f33069df5914663ba9e59afdf: Yeah, on the list
91a1154ddaa50f602cc383ee236c3517 (18:11): i'm afraid to sign for that list.  it's not *entirely* job related excpet for the websockets bits.
91a1154ddaa50f602cc383ee236c3517 (18:11): so what's he want?
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (18:11): http://www.ietf.org/mail-archive/web/hybi/current/msg03154.html
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (18:11): 91a1154ddaa50f602cc383ee236c3517: It is all WebSockets related now
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (18:11): But it is fairly high traffic
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (18:12): My long term average is to read about 30% of the mail

2562560f8ce0d1e9b326af39c5b2ca52 (18:13): 91a1154ddaa50f602cc383ee236c3517, if your job has to do with websockets, it seems really strange if you aren't following the mailing list where the protocol is being developed.
91a1154ddaa50f602cc383ee236c3517 (18:13): i'm not entirely sure how to read that "image"
91a1154ddaa50f602cc383ee236c3517 (18:13): wtf was that?
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (18:13): That was Julian I guess
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (18:14): Dunno why he joined to say that one thing
2c39bccd623947fa6224ea57d2a727de (18:14): that's his style
91a1154ddaa50f602cc383ee236c3517 (18:14): or how he even knew about it
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (18:14): At least we know who reads the logs now :)
2c39bccd623947fa6224ea57d2a727de (18:14): irc logs
2c39bccd623947fa6224ea57d2a727de (18:14): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea, that's nothing new
2c39bccd623947fa6224ea57d2a727de (18:15): though i wonder if he runs some kind of script as refreshing it all the time seems rather time consuming
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (18:15): 91a1154ddaa50f602cc383ee236c3517: Anyway, the diagram is, I think just bits across the top
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (18:15): split into 32 bit lines
91a1154ddaa50f602cc383ee236c3517 (18:16): yeah.  i was noticing that.  so the payload length is either 7bits or 64bits long if the frame-length == 127
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (18:17): Something like that
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (18:18): 2c39bccd623947fa6224ea57d2a727de: Maybe he has a script that outputs it to his irc window

91a1154ddaa50f602cc383ee236c3517 (18:20): i should subscribe, though.  i'll just have to manage the volume of it.  i end up skimming enough of the dev lists i'm already on.  and if it is mostly WS these days, it can't hurt.
91a1154ddaa50f602cc383ee236c3517 (18:20): are these framing questions also a subset of hybi then?
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (18:21): They are about WebSockets
91a1154ddaa50f602cc383ee236c3517 (18:21): i'm not sure what the relationship between websockets and hybi is.
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (18:21): The HyBi list is currently focused entirely on WebSockets
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (18:22): It is of course not impossible that that will change in the future
91a1154ddaa50f602cc383ee236c3517 (18:22): seems like WS is a bidi addition on top of HTTP while hybi is really looking at replacing all of HTTP with something a bit more modern and bidi in general
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (18:22): You might be thinking od spdy? That's not really related
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (18:23): WebSockets is only really tangentially related to HTTP
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (18:23): It's just 2 way comunication that works with the requirements of browsers
91a1154ddaa50f602cc383ee236c3517 (18:23): right.  i get the websocket/http distinction.
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (18:23): So hybi is a bit of a misnomer
91a1154ddaa50f602cc383ee236c3517 (18:24): isn't hybi a full protocol spec?
91a1154ddaa50f602cc383ee236c3517 (18:24): or more of just an umbrella project?
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (18:24): hybi doesn't really exit
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (18:24): it is just the name of the mailing list
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (18:24): not a concrete technology
91a1154ddaa50f602cc383ee236c3517 (18:24): i thought it was an actuall proposed spec
91a1154ddaa50f602cc383ee236c3517 (18:25): i see.  and spdy then is the actuall "let's get rid of http and use this" tech then.  yes?
91a1154ddaa50f602cc383ee236c3517 (18:27): so how do I subscribe to that mailing list?  not seeing anything in the messages in the archive or on the ietf site
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (18:27): https://www.ietf.org/mailman/listinfo/hybi
91a1154ddaa50f602cc383ee236c3517 (18:28): ah.  just found that.  thanks.
4979eeb075ceff988303c5159fab7f2e (18:28): hi. quick question, is there in the whole package to come with html5, things that allow to communicate with locally installed apps ?
4979eeb075ceff988303c5159fab7f2e (18:29): its possible in with flash, java applets
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (18:30): 4979eeb075ceff988303c5159fab7f2e: No. What are you trying to achieve?
91a1154ddaa50f602cc383ee236c3517 (18:31): there.  signed up.
91a1154ddaa50f602cc383ee236c3517 (18:32): how stable is spdy?  is that on topic here?  i've been eyeballing implementing that in glassfish/grizzly as well.
4979eeb075ceff988303c5159fab7f2e (18:32): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea:Computer - telephony Integration

4979eeb075ceff988303c5159fab7f2e (18:33): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea:its for a call center, using a small soft, the clients can provided cc number through the phone without the operator to see it
4979eeb075ceff988303c5159fab7f2e (18:34): this software needs then to communicate with the webapp in the browser
4979eeb075ceff988303c5159fab7f2e (18:35): anyone ?
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (18:36): 91a1154ddaa50f602cc383ee236c3517: There is not much that is off-topic here (see the /topic) but I don;t think most people follow spdy closely
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (18:37): 4979eeb075ceff988303c5159fab7f2e: I'm not sure that is possible. It at least sounds like a non-Web use case which is typically not such a high priority
91a1154ddaa50f602cc383ee236c3517 (18:37): spdy seems mostly a google effort at this point but it's certainly intriguing
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (18:37): 4979eeb075ceff988303c5159fab7f2e: Although maybe it could work with <device> or so somehow

4979eeb075ceff988303c5159fab7f2e (18:38): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea: I know it is strange, but since flash and applets are able to do that, I thought somebody would have thought of a standard alternative
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (18:39): 4979eeb075ceff988303c5159fab7f2e: Communicating with local devices is generally hard because there are all sorts of security problems
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (18:39): But the <device> element is under development for e.g. video cameras
4979eeb075ceff988303c5159fab7f2e (18:40): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea:thx I ll google that
